channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sizeable potholes, 12th March
item.description:
100 metres past the Twelve Bells heading up Birdlip Hill. Multiple sizeable potholes opening up again, at least 5 good size ones dodging them means putting yourself potentially head on in to traffic descending Birdlip Hill.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yellow Zig Zag Lines, 12th March
item.description:
The yellow school zig zags are faded and parts are missing leading to parents parking on them. They say as the lines are incomplete they can park there - as to enforce any parking restrictions it all has to be intact & visible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Lawns, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: As you enter onto St Peters you are face with the potholes in the road., 12th March
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swindon Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Request for bus stop signs/road markings, 12th March
item.description:
The bus stop called 'Hunters Way', on both sides of Station Road, close to Andoversford Community Church.On North side of road the bus stop sign is almost invisible being old, rusty and in a hedge. On South side, no indication that this is a bus stop at all. No road markings to show bus stop either. Issues: 1. Some bus drivers, from 2 companies, have denied to me that this is a bus stop- there is no sign. 2.Buses can have difficulty pulling in to kerb due to cars parked for P.O. (because drivers don't know it's a bus stop). 3.Passengers are unsure about where to wait. Recently, a resident told a person to move from their house frontage as it was not a bus stop. 4.Drivers are increasingly parking for long periods in the bus layby on the N. carriageway as, without a sign, this looks like a parking layby. Eg. to go walking or cycling. This reduces visibility for users of the church car park and makes it harder for buses to use the layby. Please can these bus stops have signs and if possible, road markings?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 12th March

item.title: Massive trench of potholes all down the road, 12th March
item.description:
Coming down Stockwell lane section under the trees before you get to Post Office Lane You have fixed one section and left the rest!!! It's a total nightmare to drive on and forget about trying to ride a bike on it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stockwell Lane, Woodmancote, Cheltenham

item.title: A pothole in pavement problem, 12th March
item.description:
Hello, Please could this bollard be replaced or hole filled in as itâ€™s currently a danger to pedestrians tripping. It can be found on old Cheltenham road, Longlevens at the crossing next to the church entrance and ruddy fish and chip shop. There were two bollards and now only one remains and a hole remaining in the ground for the other. Many thanks
Report on FixMyStreet
